body:
Hi all,


I just encountered a strange different behavior between rtrace and rpict:
If the sun ( using "source") is  covered in large parts (in that case 
more than half) I can still "see" the uncovered parts in the image 
(=>this is what I expect). In case I calculate at the same point and in 
the same direction the illuminance with rtrace -I, I get zero 
contribution.  Is just the center of the source description tested in 
that case? Any solution for this for rtrace?
I just look for the sun, no sky description and use only direct 
calculation (-ab 0) .


Thanks,


Jan
